channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Traffic; INC#0407; 08:33AM; 757 E Florence Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3OW3Md8; Florence; Firefighters responded to a three vehicle traffic accident with trapped patients. Two adult patients in critical condition and two patients with non-life threatening injuries were transported to local hospitals. ; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E21 E221 E233 E33 EM11 EM13 RA33 RA46 RA815 RA833 RA864 RA865 RA915 T21 T33; CH4; 12; Jennifer Middleton

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1562; 07:47PM; 3104 E Ganahl St; MAP: https://bit.ly/42WK72A; #BoyleHeights; 43 LAFD Firefighters with the support of LACoFD took just 19 minutes to access, confine and extinguish flames in one upstairs unit of a two-story residential duplex. No human injury. Firefighters are now caring for two puppies they rescued from the burning building. As this location at the City/County border has now been determined to be within the Los Angeles County Fire Department's jurisdiction, all further information will come from LACoFD.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E1 E16 E201 E202 E4 E450 RA1 RA2 RA801 SO1 SQ21 T1 T2 + LACoFD; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1562; 07:28PM; 3104 E Ganahl St; MAP: https://bit.ly/42WK72A; #BoyleHeights; PRELIM: Offensive fire attack at a two-story multi-family dwelling with fire on the second floor.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E1 E16 E201 E202 E4 RA1 RA801 SQ21 T1 T2; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1144; 03:50PM; 2746 James M Wood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wrJeD3; #Westlake; *Address Corrected* The first arriving 35 LAFD Firefighters took just 28 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire on the second-floor and attic of a 2,655 square foot two-story Craftsman style home (built 1911), converted to a residential duplex. No injury. The seemingly abandoned, though recently occupied structure sustained significant damage from the fire, the specific cause of which is under investigation.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC14 BC18 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E203 E210 E226 E229 E26 E29 E3 E6 E95 EM1 EM11 EM5 HR3 RA15 RA6 RA803 RA806 RA811 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T10 T26 T29 T3 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 14; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1144; 03:22PM; 2756 James M Wood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3SH3FmA; #Westlake; PRELIM; Offensive fire attack at a two-story Craftsman-style home, converted to a residential duplex, with heavy fire showing from the second floor and attic.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 E11 E210 E229 E26 E29 E6 RA6 RA806 RA811 SQ21 T10 T29; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Agency Assist - Rescue Complete - 02/21/2024 INC#0803

item.description: Update - Rescue Complete - Agency Assist; INC#0803; 03:27PM; 10424 W Foothill Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3SLcQTm; #LakeViewTerrace; Nearly three hours of well-coordinated teamwork by 61 LAFD Firefighters alongside the City's Animal Services' SMART team and Sanitation Department (working alongside an LAFD Heavy Equipment Excavator with vacuum trucks for swift and efficient soil removal) has allowed the safe and successful rescue of "Lucky", a 20 year-old female Paso Fino weighing ~1200 pounds, who suddenly sunk in soft soil that developed into a deep sinkhole in the rear yard of her home shortly after noon today. Lucky has been assisted by the SMART team in slowly walking from the yard, and is soon to be evaluated by an on-site veterinarian. There are no responder or civilian injuries. Though there have been strong rainstorms in that area in recent days and some speculation that the suddenly appearing sinkhole may be related to an old septic system, the specific cause of the sinkhole, and horse becoming trapped, cannot be formally declared by firefighters.; FS 24; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 CM40 CM42 DT1 E24 E288 E289 E290 E90 EM10 EX2 H6 H7 HA6 HA7 HE1 HR3 PI1 PI2 RA827 RA889 RA91 T87 T88 T89 T90 UR88 UR89; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Agency Assist; INC#0803; 02:45PM; 10424 W Foothill Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3SLcQTm; Lake View Terrace; The swift but delicate rescue effort by 61 LAFD responders continues, working continuously on a rotational basis, in coordination with the City's Department of Animal Services' SMART team, gingerly using hand tools, including shovels and lumber, as well as an LAFD Excavator, to safely and calmly assist "Lucky", a 20 year-old female Paso Fino weighing ~1200 pounds, who remains conscious and alert in minimal to moderate distress, trapped since noon today (in what is believed to be a standing position) up to her chest/neck in very soft backyard soil that became a sinkhole. The first of two or more LAFD lifting straps have been successfully placed beneath her barrel (torso), as the plan continues to use the teamwork of LAFD ground crews - and not an LAFD helicopter, to soundly hoist and guide her free. NOTE: A photo of the horse and rescuers can be seen on @LAFDTalk X/Twitter ( https://twitter.com/LAFDtalk/status/1760423067749388774 ). ; FS 24; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 CM40 CM42 DT1 E24 E288 E289 E290 E90 EM10 EX2 H6 H7 HA6 HA7 HE1 HR3 PI1 PI2 RA827 RA889 RA91 T87 T88 T89 T90 UR88 UR89; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Agency Assist; INC#0803; 12:35PM; 10424 W Foothill Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3SLcQTm; #LakeViewTerrace; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to assist the City of Los Angeles Department of Animal Services "Specialized Mobile Animal Rescue Team" (SMART) in rescuing a conscious and alert ~1200 pound horse (undetermined breed / gender) trapped up to its chest/neck in what is described as a backyard sinkhole of very soft soil approximately 75 yards from the nearest roadway. The horse is described as being in minimal to moderate distress. Working now with bystanders to comfort and protect the horse, LAFD responders are gingerly removing soil with shovels, as they develop a rescue plan with SMART experts, which may include fitting the horse with a specialized harness to allow an LAFD helicopter hoist rescue. LAFD Public Information Officers Captain Erik Scott and Firefighter David Ortiz are en route, ETA 2:00 PM. Note: Though there have been strong rainstorms in that area in recent days, the specific cause of the sinkhole, and horse becoming trapped, cannot be formally determined by firefighters.; FS 24; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 E24 E288 E289 E290 EM10 H6 H7 HA6 HA7 HR3 RA827 RA889 RA91 T87 T88 T89 T90 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Agency Assist; INC#0336; 07:41AM; 14299 Little Tujunga Canyon Rd; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/8kv5UuyLXrPzu4w89; #AngelesNationalForest; LAFD responding by ground and air to assist Angeles National Forest responders at the scene of what was *initially reported* as traffic collision, with one vehicle over the side and one person injured. Media Inquiries: As this location is on the Angeles National Forest, all media inquiries are currently being referred to Angeles National Forest officials.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 E298 E90 E98 H4 H6 HA4 HA6 RA100 T98 + ANF; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Update Fatality Traffic Collision; INC#0520; 10:58AM; 17300 W Saticoy St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48ntZbo; #LakeBalboa; The adult male (sole) occupant of the pickup truck is deceased and remains at scene. The critically injured adult female was the driver and sole occupant of the coupe. She is being treated at a regional trauma center. No other injuries have been reported. Though there was rain in the area this morning, the specific cause of - and any factors related to the collision, will be formally determined by LAPD Valley Traffic Division investigators.; FS 100; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 E100 E104 E273 E290 E295 E73 EM10 HR3 JT2 RA100 RA73 SQ87 SQ95 T73 T90 T95 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey
